item.title: Clay confirms it closed $100M round at $3.1B valuation
item.dc:creator: Marina Temkin
item.description: The AI sales automation startup raised fresh funds, led by CapitalG, just months after its last round.

item.title: For the first time, OpenAI models are available on AWS
item.dc:creator: Julie Bort
item.description: This is a juicy competitive move for both companies after AWS faced an onslaught of criticism over its progress with AI.

item.title: Linda Yaccarino joins health tech platform eMed as CEO after leaving X
item.dc:creator: Amanda Silberling
item.description: Though Yaccarino does not have experience in health tech, eMed said in a press release that they sought her out for her "undeniable ability to negotiate new partnerships."

item.title: Substack rival Ghost connects to the open social web with its latest public release
item.dc:creator: Sarah Perez
item.description: While the ActivityPub integration is a main selling point for Ghost 6, this major release includes a number of other changes and new additions.

item.title: OpenAI launches two ‘open’ AI reasoning models
item.dc:creator: Maxwell Zeff
item.description: For the first time in more than five years, OpenAI is launching a new open language model that appears to be state of the art.

item.title: Some people are defending Perplexity after Cloudflare ‘named and shamed’ it
item.dc:creator: Julie Bort
item.description: In a debate likely to get louder as AI agent usage grows, some people say Perplexity crawling blocked websites isn't a simple matter.

item.title: The EU AI Act aims to create a level playing field for AI innovation: Here’s what it is
item.dc:creator: Anna Heim
item.description: The European Union’s Artificial Intelligence Act, known as the EU AI Act, has been described as “the world's first comprehensive AI law” by the European Commission.

item.title: Google’s NotebookLM is now available to younger users as competition in the AI education space intensifies
item.dc:creator: Lauren Forristal
item.description: The removal of age restrictions is intended to provide younger students with access to the AI research tool, allowing them to better understand their class materials.

item.title: WhatsApp adds new features to protect against scams
item.dc:creator: Aisha Malik
item.description: The company announced that it took down over 6.8 million WhatsApp accounts linked to criminal scam centers targeting people around the world.

item.title: Three weeks after acquiring Windsurf, Cognition offers staff the exit door
item.dc:creator: Rebecca Bellan
item.description: Cognition is also laying off 30 employees. Those who don't take the buyout are expected to work 80+ hour weeks.

item.title: ElevenLabs launches an AI music generator, which it claims is cleared for commercial use
item.dc:creator: Amanda Silberling
item.description: The AI audio-generation unicorn ElevenLabs announced the launch of a new model that allows users to generate music that's cleared for commercial use.

item.title: Trump says he’ll announce semiconductor and chip tariffs
item.dc:creator: Rebecca Szkutak
item.description: This announcement comes as the Trump administration is also mulling over its approach to AI chip export restrictions.

item.title: Hacker used a voice phishing attack to steal Cisco customers’ personal information
item.dc:creator: Lorenzo Franceschi-Bicchierai
item.description: Cisco disclosed a data breach including customer names, organization names, addresses, email addresses, and phone numbers of Cisco.com users.

item.title: Crack the code to startup traction with insights from Chef Robotics, NEA, and ICONIQ at TechCrunch Disrupt 2025
item.dc:creator: TechCrunch Events
item.description: Ann Bordetsky (NEA), Rajat Bhageria (Chef Robotics), and Murali Joshi (ICONIQ) join the Builders Stage at TechCrunch Disrupt 2025. Register now to save.

item.title: Roku launches Howdy, a $2.99 ad-free streaming service
item.dc:creator: Aisha Malik
item.description: The service features a library of nearly 10,000 hours of content from Lionsgate, Warner Bros. Discovery, and FilmRise, alongside select Roku Original titles.

item.title: DeepMind thinks its new Genie 3 world model presents a stepping stone toward AGI
item.dc:creator: Rebecca Bellan
item.description: Google DeepMind has revealed Genie 3, its latest foundation world model that the AI lab says presents a crucial stepping stone on the path to artificial general intelligence, or human-like intelligence.

item.title: Only 2 days left to save $675 on your TechCrunch Disrupt 2025 ticket
item.dc:creator: TechCrunch Events
item.description: Just two days left save up to $675 on your TechCrunch Disrupt 2025 ticket. Join 10,000 tech and VC leaders October 27-29, San Francisco. Register here.

item.title: Spotify expands audiobooks access to family plan members in the US for the first time
item.dc:creator: Sarah Perez
item.description: Though Spotify launched its audiobooks service in the U.S. back in 2022, household members on Duo and Family plans have long been left out. Spotify says that will now change.

item.title: SonicWall urges customers to disable SSLVPN amid reports of ransomware attacks
item.dc:creator: Zack Whittaker
item.description: Security researchers say they have evidence that ransomware gangs are hacking into large companies that rely on fully patched SonicWall firewalls. The researchers say it's likely the flaw is a "zero-day" bug currently unknown to SonicWall.

item.title: US adds OpenAI, Google, and Anthropic to list of approved AI vendors for federal agencies
item.dc:creator: Dominic-Madori Davis
item.description: The companies will see their AI tools offered via a new federal contracting platform, the Multiple Award Schedule (MAS), which would let government agencies access AI tool sellers with pre-negotiated contracts, rather than negotiating with vendors individually.
